intro: Brunellia pallida, commonly known as the white-leafed sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its pale green to white leaves, which are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically producing a yellowish or greenish hue. Brunellia pallida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
